intro: Galium andringitrense, commonly known as the Madagascar bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Galium andringitrense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
